snippet: Ryan Clark knew about the condition when the Steelers played at Denver in 2007, but was unaware of the risk of exerting himself at high altitude and landed in the hospital.
abstract: Pittsburgh Steelers coach Mike Tomlin has decided not to play safety Ryan Clark in AFC wild-card game against Denver Broncos, citing fact that Clark's sickle cell trait makes him susceptible to organ damage if he exerts himself at high altitude.
lead_paragraph: Ryan Clark knew about the condition when the Steelers played at Denver in 2007, but was unaware of the risk of exerting himself at high altitude and landed in the hospital.

headline.seo: Steelers Sideline Safety Clark Because of Blood Trait
headline.main: Steeler’s Sickle Cell Trait and Denver Do Not Mix
headline.print_headline: For Steeler, Sickle Cell Trait and Denver’s Altitude Are a Dangerous Mix
